value.title: Data labeling will fuel the AI revolution
value.excerpt: Labeling data for AI using the right techniques helps companies make better decisions and has a measurable impact on business success.

value.title: Ex-Tesla, Impossible Foods lawyer takes top legal job at robot farming startup
value.excerpt: Myra Pasek, who was the second in-house lawyer hired by Tesla Inc's Elon Musk and the first general counsel for Impossible Foods Inc, is taking on a new startup assignment, joining Silicon Valley-based robotic farming company Iron Ox Inc as general counsel.

value.title: Neuralink and Tesla have an AI problem that Elon’s money can’t solve
value.excerpt: What do Tesla's FSD system, Neuralink's algorithms, and lazy people all have in common? It'd be great if they worked.

value.title: A system for designing and training intelligent soft robots
value.excerpt: Let's say you wanted to build the world's best stair-climbing robot. You'd need to optimize for both the brain and the body, perhaps by giving the bot some high-tech legs and feet, coupled with a powerful algorithm to enable the climb.

value.title: We love technology, until it starts loving us back.
value.excerpt: I'm on my on my science-possibly-not-so-fiction today. Sometimes being able to innovate means having the ability to think abstractly -- to still connect the dots wherever possible and to maintain accountability.

value.title: These Tiny Xenobot Robots Can Biologically Reproduce to Create a Family!

value.title: Robots made from living cells learned how to replicate themselves
value.excerpt: Xenobots, which are "living robots" made of frog cells, are simple robots that can move autonomously in a petri dish. When scientists added more cells to the dish, the xenobots pushed them together to form new xenobots.

value.title: Robot Company Wants To Give You $200,000 For Your Face And Voice
value.excerpt: In an odd proposal, a Russian company is willing to pay you $200,000 if you forfeit your face and voice to help develop its next robot.

value.title: That radio DJ you hear might already be a robot
value.excerpt: Andy Chanley has been a radio DJ for over 32 years. And now, thanks to artificial intelligence technology, his voice will live on simultaneously in many places.

value.title: You can now get £150,000 if you let a robot use your face and voice
value.excerpt: A European artificial intelligence company is offering people £150,000 to anyone willing to let their face and voice be used for a new robot.

value.title: AWS Introduces A New Platform For Developing Robotics Applications
value.excerpt: Amazon introduced AWS IoT RoboRunner during a keynote address at its Amazon Web Services (AWS) re:Invent 2021 conference – a new robotics service meant to make it easier for organisations to build and deploy apps that enable fleets of robots to work together.
